snippet: Stock markets in Europe and the United States turned out to be good investments in 2012, even as governments battled economic problems that threatened disaster.
abstract: Stock markets in Europe and the United States turned out to be good investments in 2012, even as governments battled economic problems that threatened disaster; Standard & Poor's Euro 350-stock index finished up 13 percent and S & P 500 wound up the year with 13 percent gain.
lead_paragraph: Stock markets in Europe and the United States turned out to be good investments in 2012, even as governments battled economic problems that threatened disaster.

headline.seo: A Year of Market Gains, Despite Political Turmoil
headline.main: A Year of Market Gains, Despite Turmoil
headline.print_headline: A Year of Market Gains, Despite Turmoil
